item.title: Rumor: Classic Call of Duty Character Could Be Black Ops 6 Pre-Order Bonus
item.description:
Highlights

  • Frank Woods, a classic character from the Black Ops series, may become a playable operator in the next game.
  • Black Ops titles explore unique time periods and settings, offering narrative experimentation and zombies gameplay.
  • Fans may see Frank Woods as a pre-order bonus for Black Ops 6, allowing them to control him in multiplayer.

According to the latest rumors, Frank Woods, a classic character from the Call of Duty series, may appear in the next Black Ops title as a playable operator. Frank Woods played major roles throughout the Call of Duty: Black Ops series narratives, and players may get the chance to control him in multiplayer in a future release.

The Call of Duty: Black Ops titles are famous in the franchise for maintaining a sense of narrative experimentation, visiting time periods and settings that aren't as commonly explored in Call of Duty titles. The original Black Ops game visited the 1961 Bay of Pigs invasion, as well as the Vietnam War. Series developer Treyarch also used the Black Ops series to further expand the now-standard Call of Duty Zombies gameplay. Cut content from the Black Ops titles revealed all manner of experiments and other potential gameplay innovations.

Related
Call of Duty Black Ops Gulf War Campaign Details Leak Online
The first details about the single-player campaign of Treyarch's Call of Duty: Black Ops Gulf War leak online, evoking mixed reactions from fans.

Now it looks like the next Call of Duty: Black Ops game may try to capitalize on players' affection for some of the game's recurring characters. According to Call of Duty -focused social media account CharlieIntel, data miners have uncovered hints that Frank Woods, one of the best Call of Duty campaign characters , will appear as a playable operator in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 (or whatever the game's final title turns out to be).

Playable Frank Woods Operator May Appear as Black Ops 6 Pre-Order Bonus

The tweet from CharlieIntel revealed that Frank Woods may be unlocked as a pre-order bonus for Black Ops 6 , but didn't specify which references or files found by data miners indicated the character's status as a pre-order bonus. With Microsoft gearing up to potentially reveal Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 soon, it's likely that the company has already determined what bonuses it intends to use to sweeten the deal for prospective customers.

Woods has many fans thanks to his long history with the series, and he even appeared as a revived Archetype in Black Ops 4 , long after his presumed death of old age. But the passage of time in the Black Ops timeline would ensure that Woods would be too old to take an active combat role in Black Ops 6 , even if it takes place during the 1991 Gulf War as is rumored. Including Woods as a pre-order bonus character for use in multiplayer would be the more logical choice, as they could show "Uncle Frank" off in his prime, rather than as the decrepit old man he ended up as in Black Ops 2.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fan Creates Incredible Colored Pencil Drawing of a Warlock
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Destiny 2 fan creates a stunning Warlock drawing, impressing fans with detail and shading.
  • Destiny 2 remains popular, with Guardians playing an important factor.
  • The artist emilymeganxart revealed several details about the drawing, including the type of pencils used.

A Destiny 2 fan has created a stunning drawing of a Warlock, using a variety of colored pencils to achieve the look. Since completing the impressive artwork, the user shared their interpretation of a Warlock with Destiny 2 fans, garnering praise for the drawing's incredible detail and shading.

While it might be hard to believe, Destiny 2 was released in 2017, coming roughly three years after the original game was launched by Bungie. While the title has faced controversies throughout its time on the market, it has continued to have many fans. While there are various reasons for this sustained popularity, one contributing factor is the Guardians in Destiny 2 that players get to control on the battlefield.

Related
Destiny 2 Releases Update 7.3.6.3
Bungie releases Update 7.3.6.3 for Destiny 2 making changes to special ammo in the Crucible, patching a popular Whisper cheese spot, and more.

In a post on Reddit, a user known as emilymeganxart shared a picture of their colored pencil drawing of a Warlock from the Destiny franchise . Based on the image, the artist appeared to choose an Arc theme for their Guardian, with the character fashioning what appeared to be the Crown of Tempest armor and Trinity Ghoul combat bow.

Colored Pencil Drawing of a Destiny 2 Warlock

When sharing this creation on Reddit, emilymeganxart revealed several details about the artwork. Specifically, they noted that Prismacolor soft core pencils were used to create the incredible shading in the drawing. Beyond the Warlock and galaxy in the background, the artist revealed the items on the perimeter of the paper were physical, and an official letter-making kit themed around Destiny was used for the stamp in the bottom left corner. In addition to detailing the pencils used in the drawing, the artist revealed that they plan to release a timelapse video detailing the effort put into the piece.

With this drawing of a Warlock complete, emilymeganxart has created colored pencil drawings of all the classes in the Destiny franchise. Like her Warlock, the Titan and Hunter drawings feature the Guardians brandishing iconic weapons and armor from the franchise. Impressively, the artist’s work goes beyond the Destiny universe, with some of their other art including drawings of the Master Chief and The Arbiter from the Halo series. They also drew an impressive picture of Aloy from the Horizon series.

This Warlock drawing comes at an exciting time for many Destiny 2 players, as The Final Shape expansion is on the horizon. After facing a delay, players will soon be able to experience what is expected to be the final chapter in the seasonal model of the Destiny franchise . While more is planned for after this expansion, it is safe to say that The Final Shape is likely to be a big event for the game’s universe.

item.title: The Crew 2 is Being Review Bombed
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players are review bombing The Crew 2 over Ubisoft's decision to shut down support for the original game.
  • The online-only racing game has faced backlash from fans who feel cheated by the delisting of The Crew.
  • Outraged gamers are giving The Crew 2 negative reviews and accusing Ubisoft of anti-consumer practices.

Players are review bombing The Crew 2 in response to Ubisoft's recent decision to shut down support for 2014's The Crew . Nearly six years after its release, The Crew 2 landed in the middle of a heated conflict between the franchise's longtime fans and its own creators. The online-only racing game has since seen a spike in negative reviews, reflecting the tumultuous relationship between its player base and the studio behind the series' development.

Many fans were outraged when Ubisoft announced plans to delist The Crew from official stores and shut down servers by March 31, 2024, and the topic only grew more controversial after the developer's promises came to pass. Players, many of whom were already critical of the franchise's online-only system, rallied against Ubisoft's decision to take away The Crew from their personal accounts and accused the company of theft, stating that they were not warned that they would no longer be able to play the game after the servers were shut down.

Related
The Crew Motorfest for PS5 is As Cheap As Ever
For racing game fans who are looking for games for the PlayStation 5, The Crew Motorfest is now selling at an all-time low of $34.99 on Amazon.

Now, some outraged players have taken to review bombing The Crew 2 's Steam page in retaliation. While the sequel's overall score remains fairly high at 83% with 59,872 scores, its recent reviews statistic fell to a "Mostly Negative" rating at 32%, one of the lowest if not the lowest score in the franchise's history.

Players Are Furious Over The Crew Shutdown

The negative reviews primarily criticized Ubisoft's decision to delist The Crew , with many users asking how long it would take the developer to take down its sequel in turn. Other reviewers further discouraged potential buyers from purchasing the game, citing Ubisoft's previous decisions and claiming there were better racing game alternatives in the market . Some additionally demanded a refund from Ubisoft for its complete shutdown of The Crew .

Since it decided to delist and take away access to The Crew , resentment for Ubisoft has continued to grow among the gaming community, with many believing the developer's decision was blatantly anti-consumer in nature and spelled a dark turn for the industry as a whole. Some players even went so far as to threaten legal action against Ubisoft, claiming the company's decision to permanently erase the game violated consumer protection laws from several regions.

While server shutdowns might be an accepted inevitability in the modern gaming industry, a majority of players believe that granting a developer the right to take away a product that a consumer already paid for is a slippery slope, especially when considering the rising trend of digitization in video games . Users took a stand against the practice, but it remains to be seen if Ubisoft and other companies will listen to their voices or if The Crew 2 will go the way of its predecessor.

item.title: Rumor: Call of Duty Could Be Crossing Over With Fallout
item.description:
Highlights

  • Modern Warfare 3 will soon have crossovers with Fallout, Gundam, and The Crow, expanding its list of collaborations.
  • These crossover events may take place in Season 4, adding new content and experiences for players to enjoy.
  • While details are scarce, the leaks hint at exciting additions to the game tied to popular franchises and upcoming movies.

A leak has teased that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 will soon have crossovers with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow . Call of Duty is no stranger to crossovers, having collaborated with many well-known names. It's been no different with Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 , which has added crossover content for players since its launch.

Early this year, Call of Duty players saw the announcement of a team-up between Modern Warfare 3 and The Walking Dead . Another unexpected collaboration turned Modern Warfare 3 Operators into Warhammer 40K characters through skins. For Call of Duty players and cinema fans, Modern Warfare 3 also received content from Dune: Part 2 and Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire . Modern Warfare 3 Season 3 recently began with exciting news for Call of Duty players. But a new leak has emerged, and it has good news of something that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 may get in the future.

Related
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Will Begin Testing Restricted Weapons in Ranked Play
Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 Developer Treyarch Studios says that an upcoming test will add several otherwise restricted weapons to ranked play.

Dataminers have revealed that Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 will receive crossovers with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow . Another noteworthy detail is that the crossovers may take place in Season 4, the next Modern Warfare 3 season . Twitter user CODWarfareForum released a screenshot that has been circulating on social media, showing the names of files that point to the possibility of crossover events.

Modern Warfare 3 Promises to Expand List of Call of Duty Crossovers Soon

After the Amazon Prime Video adaptation, Fallout has experienced a boost in player count across all games, even older ones like Fallout Tactics . Gundam is one of the world's most famous mecha franchises with fans from many generations. In addition to the manga and anime adaptations, Gundam has a series of games , with popular titles such as Gundam Versus and Gundam Extreme Versus Maxiboost ON . The Crow is an upcoming film starring Bill Skarsgård that adapts the famous comic book of the same name in which a murdered musician revives to avenge his death and that of his fiancée. The supposed Call of Duty crossover would be linked to the remake, which hits theaters on August 23.

There is currently no definite date for when the Modern Warfare 3 collabs with Fallout , Gundam , and The Crow will happen, nor any further details on what they will bring to the game. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Season 4, on the other hand, has an expected release in late spring or early summer. While fans wait for more information, the franchise shows no signs of stopping, with the reveal of the next Call of Duty potentially happening at the upcoming Xbox summer showcase.

item.title: Sonic the Hedgehog Getting 3 New LEGO Sets This Summer
item.description:
Highlights

  • Three new Sonic-themed LEGO sets coming out in August feature characters like Knuckles and Tails in exciting scenarios.
  • Fans can build scenarios like Knuckles protecting the Master Emerald and Sonic battling the nefarious Dr. Eggman in these sets.
  • One set features an 18+ complex version designed for adults, with callbacks to classic Sonic enemies and characters like Maria.

Three brand-new Sonic the Hedgehog -themed LEGO sets have been revealed, and are slated to be released later this August. Sega and LEGO previously collaborated to produce a few Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets in 2022, which were quite successful. This partnership continued in 2023 when five new Sonic LEGO sets were launched, which featured Sonic, Tails, and Amy. The momentum is continuing in 2024, with Sega and LEGO collaborating again on the production of three new sets.

Three new Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets were released this past January , based on Shadow, Knuckles, and Rouge. These sets were focused on aspects of their characters, such as Shadow riding a motorcycle on a highway and Knuckles battling against Rouge the Bat. Shortly after the release of these three sets, fans were clued into another three sets that will be released this summer. They won't need to wait too long for the next set either, as LEGO has confirmed when these sets will be released.

Related
Shadow the Hedgehog Voice Actor Reacts to Keanu Reeves Casting for Sonic 3
One of the former voice actors for Shadow the Hedgehog reacts to the casting of Keanu Reeves as the character in the upcoming Sonic 3 film.

New listings for these Sonic the Hedgehog LEGO sets were posted on the official website. They are known as the Knuckles and the Master Emerald Shrine, Tails' Adventure Boat, and Super Sonic vs. Egg Drillster. In these sets, fans can build a variety of scenarios, such as Knuckles guarding his precious Master Emerald from an Eggrobo, Tails and Sonic riding on a boat across the ocean, and Super Sonic and Shadow battling the nefarious Dr. Eggman who is using a deadly drilling robot. All three of these sets will be released on August 1.

Sonic the Hedgehog Summer LEGO Sets:

  • Tails' Adventure Boat ($54.99 USD)
  • Knuckles and the Master Emerald Shrine ($34.99 USD)
  • Super Sonic vs. Egg Drillster ($79.99 USD)

Details of these Sonic LEGO sets were leaked back in January, along with their prices. While the leaks got most of the details right, including the premises of each set and the projected release date, the prices were a little off, though much cheaper than what was initially leaked. The leak also included an unknown 18+ LEGO set, which is a more complex version of the standard LEGO set that is designed to be constructed by adults. That set will supposedly be released later in October 2024.

Many fans had already spotted some details that called back to the series' history in these sets. These include LEGO recreations of the classic Sonic the Hedgehog enemy robots like the aforementioned Eggrobo and the G.U.N. Beetle. One detail that fans especially liked was the inclusion of a portrait of Shadow the Hedgehog and Maria, the latter being an integral character of Shadow's tragic backstory . Maria and Shadow are even portrayed in the same limited style as the LEGO figures, which some fans found was a very nice touch.
